image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Gunlom Falls has been closed since 2019, when damage to a sacred men's site sparked a long-running legal dispute that ultimately reached the High Court.

title.children: Popular Kakadu swimming spot reopened after six-year closure

image.altText: A close up of a man wearing a suit speaking.

props.synopsis: Reforms that would standardise Working with Children Checks across the country "can't happen soon enough", the federal education minister says, in the wake of allegations of child sexual abuse at a Victorian childcare centre.

title.children: 'It's taken too long': Minister criticises Working with Children Check reforms

image.altText: Julio César Chávez Jr punches Jake Paul with a right hook to the head

props.synopsis: Famed Mexican boxer Julio César Chávez Jr is arrested in the United States just days after he fought influencer-turned-boxer Jake Paul in California.

title.children: Mexican boxer arrested in US by ICE, days after fight against Jake Paul

image.altText: Debris and a traffic cone can be seen near shrubbery.

props.synopsis: Authorities investigating the deaths of Liverpool footballer Diogo Jota and his brother say they are trying to determine how fast their car was travelling before it crashed.

title.children: Speed and burst tyre loom large as police probe Diogo Jota's fatal crash

image.altText: A silhouette of a hand holds a mobile phone with a blank white screen

props.synopsis: I was transferring my mobile number to a new provider when my phone service cut out. That was my first clue that my identity had been stolen.

title.children: I was a victim of cybercrime. This is what I wished I'd paid attention to

image.altText: A young man smiling at the camera, wearing a tuxedo as he stands inside a living room.

props.synopsis: NSW Police allege the boys — 17 and 16 — donned dark clothing and approached "innocent" 21-year-old Luke Manassa in Sydney's west last Thursday night.

title.children: Teens hired to murder as man stabbed to death in case of 'mistaken identity'

image.altText: Qantas Departure sign outside airport terminal

props.synopsis: Qantas boss Vanessa Hudson has finally spoken to media following the massive cyber attack. Meanwhile, the Australian share market is expected to open higher today, after Wall Street set record highs. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Qantas CEO breaks silence on cyber attack, ASX set to rise after Wall St rally

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Qantas boss says call centre staff are well trained despite massive cyber attack
Qantas CEO finally speaks from London after massive cyber attack
Australians stand to lose hundreds of millions in super

image.altText: Two search and rescue dinghies on the water

props.synopsis: After temporarily halting a search for 29 people still missing after a ferry carrying 65 people sank near Bali, leaving at least six dead, authorities will resume their search for survivors today.

title.children: Body of three-year-old and mother recovered as Bali ferry search continues

image.altText: a child shovels sand into a plastic bucket

props.synopsis: Federal officers would be given the power to conduct spot checks at childcare centres as part of fast-tracked laws set to be introduced later this month. Follow live.

title.children: Fast-tracked childcare laws to establish power for spot checks of sector

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Minister provides more detail on childcare spot check
New powers for spot checks of childcare centres

image.altText: A court sketch of Keith Russell Yandle.

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Keith Russell Yandle, whose victim was found buried at a property north of Adelaide in 2023, has been jailed for 32 years over the "calculated, ruthless" shooting murder.

title.children: Killer jailed for 32 years over 'calculated, ruthless' murder

image.altText: Against a dark background, Khaled Sabsabi with hair pulled back and dark shirt has mouth closed in serious expression.

props.synopsis: Many are celebrating that Khaled Sabsabi and Michael Dagostino have had their Venice Biennale invitation reinstated. But the impact of the decision, and the many questions surrounding it, remain.

title.children: Creative Australia's apology 'does not actually clarify' why it dumped artist

image.altText: Two Palestinian women crying and embracing in a crowd.

props.synopsis: Hamas is seeking guarantees from the US that a ceasefire with Israel will lead to a lasting end to the war.

title.children: Deadly strikes hit Gaza as Israel intensifies campaign

image.altText: Water spilling over the road as a truck drives in the background

props.synopsis: This week's destructive weather on Australia's east coast has broken rain and wind records, with the Bureau of Meteorology saying some of the gusts recorded have been as strong as those during ex-Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: Record-breaking rainfall and winds hit Australia's east coast

image.altText: Shelton1

props.synopsis: Rinky Hijikata and Ben Shelton's Wimbledon match is controversially suspended, as Daria Kasatkina and Alex de Minaur claim victories.

title.children: Aussie caught up in Wimbledon farce, as Kasatkina and de Minaur win

image.altText: Composite image of Steve Smith, Shamar Joseph and Travis Head during an Australia-West Indies Test.

props.synopsis: Australia's middle order rescues the team again as Cameron Green fails to cash in on his best start in a year in Grenada. Here are five quick hits from the first day of the second Test against the West Indies.

title.children: Five quick hits: More Aussie stumbles and Green can't punish fumble

image.altText: Brad Fittler celebrates after scoring a try, State of Origin Game III, 2004, hugged by teammates

props.synopsis: Josh Papalii is far from the first State of Origin star to return from retirement for one last crack in the game's toughest arena. Here's how every Origin comeback over the years has fared, plus a couple of near misses that could have changed the course of history.

title.children: Winners, losers and legends: A short history of State of Origin comebacks

image.altText: Andy Lee stands behind a stand and microphone in a recording booth with head phones on. His arms are up as he reads a line

props.synopsis: Andy Lee is no stranger to TV, but when it came to turning his best-selling kids' book into a show for the ABC, it was a process unlike anything he had experienced before.

title.children: Andy Lee's desperate plea: Do Not Watch This Show

image.altText: Michael Madsen in a black suit jacket and white shirt smiling while standing in front of a black red carpet banner

props.synopsis: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill made him a stand-out in Quentin Tarantino's films, dies aged 67.

title.children: Reservoir Dogs and Kill Bill star Michael Madsen dies at 67

image.altText: Unidentified child's hands playing with building bricks.

props.synopsis: When news broke on Tuesday of the arrest of a childcare worker on more than 70 child sex charges, it set off a tidal wave of disbelief, disgust and rage.

title.children: At the centre of childcare allegations are Melbourne families left reeling

image.altText: Two police officers in navy uniforms stand in front of a white and blue police car parked beside a road.

props.synopsis: A man was shot dead after firing at police during a siege in the tiny Victorian town of Daisy Hill in the Central Goldfields.

title.children: Man shot dead by police during exchange of gunfire in regional Victoria

image.altText: Sean Combs, wearing a black jacket, looks neutrally off camera in front of plastered logos.

props.synopsis: A relieved Sean Combs claps his hands in court and tells his family he will be home soon, but the matter is not over yet.

title.children: Diddy celebrated the jury's verdict as a victory, but his legal woes are far from over

image.altText: Looking down from the top of Gunlom Falls in the Northern Territory.

props.synopsis: Gunlom Falls has been closed since 2019, when damage to a sacred men's site sparked a long-running legal dispute that ultimately reached the High Court.

title.children: Popular Kakadu swimming spot reopened after six-year closure

image.altText: Muslim preacher Wissam Haddad arrives at court next to a man wearing a suit

props.synopsis: More than a decade ago political passions ran high in conservative circles about the alleged evils of 18C. This week it was only briefly back in the news cycle.

title.children: The issues that once caused political storms barely registered this week

image.altText: British and Irish Lions' Owen Farrell kicks a goal from the tee

props.synopsis: Owen Farrell will join his fourth tour, having played 18 times for the Lions, including six Tests across the 2013, 2017 and 2021 tours.

title.children: Lions veteran Farrell flown to Australia after tour-ending injury to Daly

image.altText: ADHD meds

props.synopsis: Some of the most common medications for ADHD are set to be in short supply until the end of the year, which means plenty of people across Australia may find their pharmacist can't fill their prescriptions.

title.children: Why are ADHD meds in short supply, and what can you do about it?

image.altText: A bat wrapped up in a towel.

props.synopsis: A northern NSW man has become the fourth person to die of lyssavirus in Australia. The disease is incredibly rare but extremely dangerous. So what are the symptoms, how is it treated and how can you avoid infection?

title.children: What we know about the rare bat disease that has killed another Australian

image.altText: Two young women in one-piece swimsuits lean against each other by an indoor pool

props.synopsis: Travel to the High-Performance Centre, where toned young athletes scheme, lie and compromise as they compete for an elusive sponsorship deal.

title.children: Sex, scandals and synchronised swimming: Olympo takes us behind the scenes

image.altText: Michael Cockburn stands on a ladder and uses a garden hose to put water on a shed fire at night. Large flames light the scene.

props.synopsis: When his neighbour's shed burst into flames in the middle of the night, Michael Cockburn rushed to help — but poor mobile coverage meant his calls to triple-0 went in vain.

title.children: Jurien Bay resident unable to reach emergency services as shed burned

image.altText: A female Victorian politician dressed in black, wearing glasses, seated in an ABC TV studio

props.synopsis: Six new train stations linking Box Hill in Melbourne's east to Cheltenham in the south-east are under construction but the funding stream is not locked in yet. However, Victoria's Suburban Rail Loop Minister Harriet Shing is confident the Commonwealth and developers will get on board.

title.children: Minister argues backing out of $34b project would fail a growing city

image.altText: Big swell and large waves on Sydney's Northern Beaches brought on by bad weather along the NSW east coast.

props.synopsis: From wild weather battering the NSW coast to a massive data leak, it has been another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Wild weather, a data leak and a skeleton in a pot

image.altText: Close up profile shot of someone tucking into a ham and cheese toasted sandwich.

props.synopsis: With a billion dollars worth of ham and bacon imports pushing Australian pork out of supermarket delis in the past year, the industry wants consumers to push back and demand locally grown.

title.children: Fancy all-Australian ham on your toastie? Good luck with that

image.altText: Mr Squiggle and his blackboard on display.

props.synopsis: Mr Squiggle lit up TV screens for 40 years. Now, the National Museum of Australia in Canberra is displaying the show's iconic items.

title.children: Mr Squiggle, the man from the moon, is novel for kids, nostalgic for parents
